answers.answer: I have them too. They are worse depending on what I've been watching. Its a part of pregnancy for some reason.

Nightmares are horrible but it's just another symptom. It's due to what you see plus what you think. Try not to stress over it. It used to happen all the time to me, and now it just happens every once in a while.
This may sound silly, but with my first baby, I couldn't eat after 6pm without having nightmares. It's just a pregnancy thing.

I have gestational diabetes and I've had dreams of giving birth to a toddler lol. I guess because babies born from mothers with gestational diabetes are apperantly a lot larger in size. I'm also only about 114 now and 26 weeks so I'll have nightmares about c section cause everyone tells me hell be too big with how small I am. Never really remembered any dreams til I got pregnant because they are so crazy lol

question: Hey everyone and thank you for taking the time to read my question! Lately I've been having the most disturbing dreams about my pregnancy. Does any one else having disturbing dreams?? It's been about 2 weeks now.
title: Disturbing dreams
